snippet: The drug pairs Merck’s Zetia, which lowers low-density lipoprotein, with the generic version of Lipitor, the best-selling statin made by Pfizer that lost its patent protection in 2011.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration approves combination drug developed by Merck that lowers patients' cholesterol but has not been shown to reduce risk of cardiovascular disease or death; drug, to be called Liptruzet, pairs Merck's Zetia with generic version of Lipitor, best-selling statin made by Pfizer that lost patent protection in 2011.
lead_paragraph: The drug pairs Merck’s Zetia, which lowers low-density lipoprotein, with the generic version of Lipitor, the best-selling statin made by Pfizer that lost its patent protection in 2011.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Approves Merck’s Combination Drug to Reduce Cholesterol
headline.main: Drug to Cut Cholesterol Is Approved by the F.D.A.
headline.print_headline: Drug to Cut Cholesterol Is Approved By the F.D.A.
